page.title: 14TAYLORS TRANSPORT DEPOT
page.content: {Taylors Contracting}business opened as a family concern in{1920,}funded by Mr. Edgar Taylor's war gratuity. Today it is a combined business,{employing {55 people}from{Wichenford, Broadheath, {Martley}and{Clifton-upon-Teme. Originally Taylors delivered{logs, {coal}and{bread but gradually they expanded, and in 1939 they were working two tipper lorries to transport{quarry stone}to R.A.F at Pershore and Defford, and for local Councils. Currently they have{5 rigid-tray}and {30 articulated lorries}in the fleet, and they travel throughout the U.K. Their contracts include{Metal Box. The latest additions to the business are the{four warehouses. Employlees are loyal and happy, enjoying occasional social events together as well as work comradeship.
